Title: Object: Les Israélites sortant d'Egypte
Series: Galerie du Palais Royal
Description: The Hebrews leaving Egypt, after a painting attributed to Veronese: classical setting with at centre a man carrying a heavy bundle and a woman leaving a house and walking down some stairs, at right more figures following them; with engraved text below. c.1800/10 Etching and engraving
Producer name: Print made by: François Louis Couché (etching)
Curator's comments: From the second volume of 'Galerie du Palais Royal', a set published between 1786 and 1808; see 1837,0408.317 for comment. The painting is in the Musée des Beaux-Arts, Caen. The attribution to Veronese is debated, and it has been suggested the painting could be the work of the artist's studio, or Benedetto Caliari. See Pignatti & Pedrocco, 'Veronese', Milan 1995, cat. No.A 10, p.506.
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (12) (under Louis François Couché)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
